meanings.definition: To surpass in catching or capturing.
meanings.sent1: She was outcatching all her friends in the game of tag.
meanings.sent2: The skilled outfielder was outcatching every ball that came her way.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outcatching all the other animals in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His quick reflexes allowed him to outcatch the falling vase before it hit the ground.
meanings.sent5: The spider was outcatching its prey with its intricate web.

meanings.definition: The act of catching or capturing something better than others.
meanings.sent1: His outcatching of the rare butterfly impressed the nature enthusiasts.
meanings.sent2: The outcatching of the criminal was a result of the detective's hard work.
meanings.sent3: The outcatching of the biggest fish in the lake made for an exciting fishing story.
meanings.sent4: Her outcatching of the spotlight at the talent show surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The outcatching of the golden opportunity led to his success.
